column1: Narrator : The island is immense. CAPITAINE can't see anything, but faintly hears music from behinds the sand dunes near the beach.

column4: Narrator : A guard stands in front of a small wooden door. As you approach, he raises his hand to stop you.
OtherSpeak : To enter, you need to show a deck of cards.
column14: OtherSpeak : Then be on your way.
column17: OtherSpeak : You think that's funny, do you?

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE steps into an old gambling house, crowded with shouting sailors. They’re all playing heated games of cards and dice.
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE opens the doors of a shabby bar. A few players betting their last coins or possessions. Behind the counter, a waiter is wiping a few tankards.
column8: Narrator : In a dark and narrow room, CAPITAINE stands in front of a few tense men, sitting around a table.
column11: Narrator : CAPITAINE steps into a bar, crowded with heated sailors, playing all kind of games of cards and dice.
Narrator : Some musicians in the corner are playing to lighten the mood.

column2: Choice : Is there space for another player?
column7: Narrator : Before CAPITAINE can step forward, a handful of men approaches.

column12: OtherSpeak : Look! Our sailor’s coming back!

column7: OtherSpeak : We have a favour to ask if you have some time?
OtherSpeak : A dog ate all of our cards. Don’t ask how it happened.
OtherSpeak : So we have money to put on the table, but no cards to play with...
OtherSpeak : You wouldn’t have a spare one, by any chance?

column1: Narrator : The gambling house is empty. The staff and musicians all left during the fight.
column9: Choice : Sorry, I’m keeping this one…
column11: Choice : Sorry pals, I don’t have any.
column12: Choice : I think I’ll keep this one…

column10: OtherSpeak : Then I guess we’ll have to take it from you!
column13: OtherSpeak : Then I guess we’ll have to take it from you!

column8: OtherSpeak : But if you find one, you know where to find us!

column2: Narrator : There’s nothing to grab here, apart from a deck of cards that miraculously wasn't scattered during the fighting.
column3: Narrator : The gambling house is completely trashed, nothing survived the fight.
column4: PlayerSpeak : That's what I'm talkin' about!
column7: OtherSpeak : Why don’t you play with us?
OtherSpeak : Here’s something to start with! As a thank you gift!

column8: Choice : I’m good for now, but thanks for the coin!

column7: Choice : A little game won’t kill me...

column1: OtherSpeak : Howdy sailor, what’s your poison today?

column5: Choice : I need info about NOMTRESOR if you heard of it?
column9: Choice : What’s going on ‘round these parts ?

column5: OtherSpeak : Ah yeah! From what I hear here, and I hear a lot trust me... I'd advise you head DIRECTIONTOFORMULA!
column6: OtherSpeak : Nope, doesn't ring a bell, sorry.
column7: OtherSpeak : It depends on the players luck mostly.
column9: OtherSpeak : If  you want alcohol, I’m here.

column7: OtherSpeak : Sometimes, we’re one dice roll away from being bankrupt!
column9: OtherSpeak : You want conversation buddy, go get friends.

column1: OtherSpeak : Something’s off! You can't just win so easily!
OtherSpeak : You’re a dirty cheater if I ever saw one!
OtherSpeak : Give us back 150 gold coins or.. die.

column2: OtherSpeak : Glad we reached an understanding.
OtherSpeak : Now get out of here.
column3: OtherSpeak : You don’t even have enough?!
